text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 5:45 pm Man City host Monaco on Tuesday night (Getty Images – Credit: MylesGoode) 
Manchester City are next up to represent the Premier League on the European stage. 
After Arsenal’s capitulation to Bayern Munich last week it’s hoped that Pep Guardiola oversees a better job or otherwise that ‘best league in the world’ tagline will start to look like a bad joke. 
Facing them in the Round of 16 first leg are Monaco, the team currently sitting at the top of Ligue 1. Ahead of Tuesday’s game here’s the info you really ought to know. It’s a big game for… 
Sergio Aguero . It’s been a weird season for the Man City striker – going from a much loved lethal centre-forward to an ill-disciplined dilemma of a player. But with Gabriel Jesus out injured it will fall to the Argentinean to provide the main goal threat at the Etihad. It’ll provide him with the perfect opportunity to remind Guardiola and everyone else just how important he is to the side. Likely line-ups… 
Vincent Kompany is out injured, and as mentioned, so is Jesus. Gael Clichy will face a late fitness test while Guardiola must pick between Willy Caballero and Claudio Bravo in goal. 
Monaco midfielder Gabriel Boschilia is out with a cruciate ligament injury while Jemerson is suspended. If you memorise one stat, memorise this… 
It turns out Radamel Falcao didn’t lose it after all. The Colombian who was so hapless during his time in England with Manchester United and Chelsea is back among the goals. He’s scored 19 goals in 25 games this season. In 29 appearances for Manchester United he scored four. Falcao has been on fire this season (Getty) Last time they met…
